meanings.definition: To eat a large amount of food, especially in a greedy or indulgent manner.
meanings.sent1: After the game, we decided to pigout on pizza and soda.
meanings.sent2: During the party, everyone loves to pigout on snacks and desserts.
meanings.sent3: At the buffet, he couldn't resist the chance to pigout on all the delicious dishes.
meanings.sent4: She tends to pigout on sweets when she's feeling stressed.
meanings.sent5: The kids always pigout on candy during Halloween.

meanings.definition: An instance of eating a large amount of food, especially in a greedy or indulgent manner.
meanings.sent1: Last night's pigout left me feeling uncomfortably full.
meanings.sent2: The family's holiday pigout included a variety of dishes from different cultures.
meanings.sent3: His pigout at the all-you-can-eat restaurant was both impressive and concerning.
meanings.sent4: The pigout at the picnic was a sight to behold, with plates piled high with food.
meanings.sent5: The pigout at the office potluck was a delicious disaster.
